step.context: \text{Before we start differentiating, }\\ \text{for what values of x is f(x) defined?}
step.reason: \text{If }x=\pi,2\pi,3\pi\ldots \text{ then }\sin x = 0.\\ \text{And at such points, }f(x)=\dfrac{e^x}{\sin x}\text{ is not defined.}

step.context: \text{If }f(x) = \dfrac{g(x)}{h(x)}\text{, then which of} \\ \text{the following is true?}
step.reason: \text{This is a standard result. And its called the}\\ \textbf{Quotient Rule}.\text{ Review if you got it wrong.}
\text{Other than the Quotient Rule, we have used}\\ \text{the facts that }\dfrac{d}{dx}e^x = e^x \text{ and }\dfrac{d}{dx}\sin x = \cos x.

choices.tex: \dfrac{x\cdot e^x\cos x}{\sin^2 x}, x\neq n\pi, n\in\mathbb{Z}
\dfrac{e^x\cdot (\sin x - \cos x)}{\sin^2 x}, x\neq n\pi, n\in\mathbb{Z}
